If past patterns hold, we can expect Bush to do something stupid soon, then we can get back to debating.

 
 That shouldn't take too long. As we continue our crusade of spreading democracy Fajullah now looks like Beirut (the inspiration for Bin Laden's twin towers attack), interest rates are going up to satisfy our creditors in a flat economy and China has reduced their annual growth to a paltry 12% as they concentrate on preparing their infrastructure for additional industrial expansion. He'll have to pick a fight with another third tier nation (low casualties) to expand the war footing or al Qaeda will hit us again. Rust never sleeps and we have a bad case of that.

We could always talk about how the Democrats still can't believe they lost...or about the bigotted attacks on Condi Rice. What's with these people?
georged

We could always talk about how the Democrats still can't believe they lost...or about the bigotted attacks on Condi Rice. What's with these people?

 
 I've found it interesting that the US, in our constant effort to prove that we champion equality to disguise our basic racism, appoints women to sensitive cabinet positions where they'll deal with primarily men. Men who, in most cases, are world leaders and as egotistical and chauvinistic as their positions of power allow. I understand domestic political necessity of female representation due to the simple fact that more women than men are voters.
 Does this mean those representatives are 'world window dressing'? 
 
 I certainly can't imagine a ranking member of the Saud family, as despotic and hostile to women's rights as it gets, privately confiding in Albright or Rice over brandy and a cigar. With the exception of the British, considered as a world power out of past consideration, I'm unable to think of any other world power that doesn't generally exclude women from positions of power.

 Women in power - not many - but what about Indira Gandhi (India), and the President of Indonesia, Megawati Sukarnoputri is a woman. Helen Clark made it to the top in New Zealand. Can't think of any more apart from the woman who used to run Ceylon, Mrs Bandaranike ? I think was her name.

 After devoting so much time to it in the recent past I am enjoying some time away. We all know what they say though. " It's sure good to come home again." I'll see you guys there soon. :) :) :)
